name: Celebrity Guest Stars Online Trivia | Mixture: Comedy | 10 Questions

questions.text: In "Golden Girls", Rose believes that she is related to ...?
questions.explanation:
Bob Hope.

	Bob Hope was in town - and would appear at the girls' show - because he was (presumably) related to Rose.

questions.text: In "Mary Tyler Moore", Mary has a conversation with which First Lady?
questions.explanation:
Betty Ford.

	By phone, during one of Mary's parties.

questions.text: This celebrity doesn't actually appear during an episode of "MASH", but the rumor is that she will soon be visiting the troops.
questions.explanation:
Marilyn Monroe.

	The episode is built around how the rumor "takes off".

questions.text: In "Cheers", Norm embarrasses himself during a conversation at the bar with a celebrity that he doesn't recognize at first.
questions.explanation:
"Tip" O'Neill.

	Hart and McHale also appear in the series, but it's O'Neill that has the awkward conversation with Norm at the bar.

questions.text: In an episode of "Odd Couple", Felix must deal with Howard Cosell. Why?
questions.correct: Felix is photographing an ad in which Cosell appears
options: Cosell is a member of the opera club that Felix runs
They're both trustees at a local museum
questions.explanation:
Felix is photographing an ad in which Cosell appears.

	The one-and-only Howard Cosell. Entertaining.

questions.text: In "Kate and Allie", Allie goes out of control and is excited when this celebrity is filming a scene nearby.
questions.explanation:
Paul Newman.

	The episode revolves around her attempts to meet him.

questions.text: It goes without saying that Danny Thomas appeared now and then on "That Girl". What other comedian appeared with Danny in one of the show's episodes?
questions.explanation:
Milton Berle.

	Two legendary comedians working as guest stars.

questions.text: In "I Love Lucy", Lucy demolishes the room where this movie star is staying.
questions.explanation:
Cornel Wilde.

	Many guest stars appeared on the show - and all experienced one problem or another. It was Wilde, however, who had his room wrecked.

questions.text: In "Happy Days", Ron Howard encounters people from what classic tv show?
questions.explanation:
Howdy Doody.

	Buffalo Bob and Clarabelle come to town.

questions.text: In "Maude", Beatrice Arthur comes face-to-face with a star from a different political persuasion.
questions.explanation:
John Wayne.

	Wayne's politics were diametrically opposed to Maude's. Cute stuff.
